data.event: It was first settled about 1780 by colonists of English descent from Massachusetts and New Hampshire.

event.title: was incorporated by the Massachusetts General Court in 1771

data.event: It was incorporated by the Massachusetts General Court in 1771 as part of Winslow.

event.title: 1802, the area west of the Kennebec River was incorporated

data.event: In 1802, the area west of the Kennebec River was incorporated as Waterville.
The Maine State Legislature complied, and on February 26, 1873 incorporated it as West Waterville.
In 1883, it was renamed Oakland, presumably after all the oak trees in the town, though some favored the name Weldon.
